p: A total of 57.4% (190/331) of the positive samples of HMPV were pharyngeal swab, 39% (129/331) were nasopharyngeal swab, 3.3% (11/331) were bronchioalveolar washes and 0.3% (1/331) were biopsies. 89% of the HMPV positive samples (297/331) were taken during the first five days of the onset of symptoms, and 10.3% (34/331) were taken six to 10 days after the onset of symptoms. In females, there were 55% of positive cases of HMPV, while this was 45% in males.
